AppliedOnly.description: Filter to return only tags that have been applied to NGINX instances.
AppliedOnly.name: appliedOnly

CertName.description:
The name of the Cert. As of 2.4 release, this could also be the uuid of the cert, in lieu of name. The
use of name as unique identifier may be deprecated in a future release.
CertName.name: certName

ConfigUid.name: configUid

DeploymentUid.description: The unique identifier that was generated for the deployment.
DeploymentUid.name: deploymentUid

EndTime.description:
Indicates the end of the time window to include objects from (non-inclusive).

- Must be greater than `startTime`.
- If `endTime` is not specified when `startTime` is present, `endTime` defaults to the current time.
- In Events API requests, `endTime` must be provided if `startTime` was specified.
- In Security Events API requests, `startTime` must be provided if `endTime` was specified.
EndTime.name: endTime

ExternalId.description: The commit ID of the config.
ExternalId.name: externalId

Filter.description:
Filters results based on key value pairs.

Consists of one or more predicates in the form  `<key><operator><value>` where:
- `<key>` is the name of the dimension.
- `<operator>` is one of the supported operators (`=`, `!=`, `<`, `<=`, `>=` `>`, `in` or `not`).
- `<value>` is value of the dimension(s) that you want to filter on.
- `<key> and <value>` is case sensitive.

For example: 'count > 100'

Predicates can be combined into logical expressions using `OR`, `AND`, and `(` `)`.
For matching values, wildcard (`*`) use is supported.

Wrapping predicates in single quotes is required to ensure that the full query string is processed correctly.

See the Dimensions Catalog to find out more about Dimensions.

- For SecOps APIs:
  - Only the `=` operator is supported
  - Catalog of dimensions is currently not available
  - Available set of dimensions can be seen from the GUI
Filter.name: filter

schema.example: ((server_zone!='server_zone_1' OR server_zone='server_zone_2') AND nginx_id in ('id1', 'id2')) AND (system.tags!='*tag1*')

InstSetUid.name: instSetUid

InstUid.name: instUid

InstanceSetNameFilter.description: The instance set names to filter.
InstanceSetNameFilter.name: setNameFilter

InstanceSetSystemNameFilter.description: The instance set systems names to filter to allow you to find instance sets that contain the specified instance name
InstanceSetSystemNameFilter.name: systemNameFilter

IsNewRevision.description: Boolean indicating if the security policy being created is a new revision of an existing security policy.
IsNewRevision.name: isNewRevision

Limit.description: Size limit for the collection returned, used in pagination. A value of 0 indicates that no results are to be returned except for a total.
Limit.name: limit

LogProfileName.description: The name of the security log profile.
LogProfileName.name: logProfileName

NAPOnly.description: Filter instances to those having NGINX App Protect enabled.
NAPOnly.name: napOnly

NginxUid.description: The ID of the NGINX instance.
NginxUid.name: nginxUid

Offset.description: Offset starting zero-based index to use for the collection returned, used in pagination.
Offset.name: offset

OrderBy.description: Sorting for the collection returned, composed of one or more descending order by criteria. Format is <field>-[asc,desc].
OrderBy.name: orderBy

PageSize.description:
Defines the number of returned items per page.

- The maximum value is 100. If value is greater, it is automatically set down to 100.
- If `pageSize`=0, pagination is disabled and all events will be returned in the response.
- The response size is limited to 10,000 results. If the number of results exceeds 10,000 a warning is returned.
PageSize.name: pageSize

PageToken.description:
Transactional token used for pagination.

The token ensures consistency of the query results across requests for various pages of data. It provides a snapshot of the database contents from the time at which the query was received.

If `pageToken` is not provided with a page request, a token is automatically generated and will be returned in the response metadata. You should include the token in subsequent requests for pages in the query results.

Sending a query without a `pageToken` refreshes the query results.
PageToken.name: pageToken

PolicyName.description: The name for a specific security policy.
PolicyName.name: policyName

Resolution.description:
Changes the granularity of the returned data. Applicable only for endpoints that return time series data.

- Must be a valid duration -- a string starting with a number followed by a unit of time (`y`, `M`, `w`, `d`, `h`, `m` or `s`).
- SecOps APIs:
  - If you do not provide a resolution, the default value of `1h` will be used.
  - When using a `resolution`, you must also provide a `startTime` and `endTime`.
- Metrics API:
  - When using a resolution, you must provide an aggregate function (or functions) in the `names` parameter and `startTime`.
  - If you do not provide a resolution, the maximum available resolution will be returned (`endTime` - `startTime`).
Resolution.name: resolution

RevisionTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the revision for the threat campaign or attack signature.
RevisionTimestamp.name: revisionTimestamp

SecurityPolicyUID.description: The globally unique identifier for a specific security policy.
SecurityPolicyUID.name: securityPolicyUID

ShowDetails.description: Return all system details in the response if set to true.
ShowDetails.name: showDetails

StartTime.description:
Indicates the start of the time window to include collection elements from (inclusive).

- Must be provided if `endTime` was specified.
- In Metrics API requests, if `startTime` is omitted, the last recorded value for the queried Metrics will be returned.
- In Metrics API requests - for aggregated Metrics - you must provide `startTime` to calculate the resolution
- In Events API requests, if you do not set a `startTime`, the most recent 100 Events will be returned
- In SecOps API requests, `startTime` does not have a default value
StartTime.name: startTime

Tags.description: Filter systems by one or more tag values. Systems having no tags will be included.
Tags.name: tags

TemplateGroupName.description: The name of the Template Groups.
TemplateGroupName.name: templateGroupName

Versions.description: String indicating that the versions for the security policy name should be returned.
Versions.name: versions

count.description:
Specifies the desired maximum number of query results per page. A value of "0" indicates
that no resource results are to be returned except for "totalResults".
count.name: count

groupName.description: The name or uid of the group.
groupName.name: groupName

showDetails.description: Return all feature details in the response if set to true.
showDetails.name: showDetails

source.description: Filter for the type of users to return in the response.
source.name: source

startIndex.description: The 1-based index of the first query result.
startIndex.name: startIndex

userName.description: The name or uid for the User resource.
userName.name: userName

readable.description: Indicates whether log file is readable

AccessType.description:
Access determines the Role's ability to access a path or object. The options are:
* CREATE: Has create only access (HTTP POST requests)
* READ: Has read only access (HTTP GET requests)
* UPDATE: Has update only access (HTTP PUT requests)
* DELETE: Has delete only access (HTTP DELETE requests)

Agent.description: The properties of the NGINX controller agent running on the system.

accessibleDirs.description: The directories of Controller Agent that is allowed accessing to.

version.description: The version of Controller Agent that is currently running on the instance.

values.description: Returns the unique count of all active Nginx plus instances corresponding to the timestamp.

AnalysisResponse.description: Defines result of NGINX configuration analysis.

contents.description: The base64 encoded contents of the file.

name.description: Absolute path of the configuration file.

AppProtect.description: This object represents the state of NGINX App Protect. It lets you look up the App Protect system status and which versions of App Protect and related Threat Campaigns and Attack Signatures are installed.

attackSignatureVersion.description: The NGINX App Protect Attack Signature version

precompiledPublication.description: Indicates whether publication of NGINX App Protect pre-compiled content is enabled

status.description:
The NGINX App Protect status.
- inactive: Indicates that App Protect is installed but not enabled.
- active: Indicates that App Protect is installed and enabled.

threatCampaignVersion.description: The NGINX App Protect Threat Campaign version

AttackSignatureAssociationDetails.description: The attack signature revision association details.

filename.description:
Single tgz file containing the attack signature, update and version files.

The contents of the .tgz are listed below and typically come from a rpm/deb downloaded install package 
located on a system (not NMS). All the below files must be included in the .tgz:

 - signatures.bin.tgz
 - signature_update.yaml
 - version

associations.description: The list of attack signature associations.

versions.description: The list of attack signature versions.

uid.description: The globally unique identifier for the attack signature.

release.description: NGINX Plus release string, only present for NGINX Plus instances

CPUCache.description: Information about CPU cache layout and sizes.

hypervisor.description: The hypervisor this system is running on

publish.description: Flag indicating whether the cert should be published after assignments.

assignedKeyPaths.description: List of assigned certificate key path pairs.

configKeyPaths.description: Internally managed list of configured (referenced in a configuration) and successfully deployed certificate key path pairs.

deployments.description: Deployment identifiers for updates to instances or instance groups. Returned when a request has one or more publish flags set to true.

validFrom.description: The start of the validity period for the certificate.

validTo.description: The end of the validity period for the certificate.

cert.description: The cert file path as referenced in the NGINX configuration.

key.description: The key file path as referenced in the NGINX configuration.

authorityKeyIdentifier.description: The identifier of the signing authority for the certificate.

commonName.description: The Common Name (CN) for the certificate. This is typically a Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN), and must be the same as the web address users access when connecting to a web site.

expired.description: Indicates the expiration status of the certificate.

expiry.description: The number of seconds until the certificate will expire.

issuer.description: Identifies the entity who signed and issued the certificate.
issuer.example: DigiCert Class 3 Extended Validation SSL SGC CA.

publicKeyType.description: Identifies the encryption algorithm used to create the public key for the certificate.

serialNumber.description: A unique identifier for the certificate.

signatureAlgorithm.description: Identifies the algorithm used to sign the certificate.

subject.description: Contains the Distinguished Name (DN) information for the certificate.

subjectAlternativeName.description: Defines additional identifies bound to the subject of the certificate. For example, the DNS name is used to add addtional domain names to a certificate.

subjectKeyIdentifier.description: A hash value of the SSL certificate that can be used to identify certificates that contain a particular public key.
subjectKeyIdentifier.example: 31 EA 76 A9 23 74 A5 DF D4 FD EE A0 C1 A6 9E C6 11 0E 11 EC

thumbprint.description: A hash to ensure that the certificate has not been modified.

thumbprintAlgorithm.description: Defines the algorithm used to hash the certificate.

validFrom.description: The start of the validity period for the certificate.

validTo.description: The end of the validity period for the certificate.

version.description: The version of the certificate, typically 3 for X.509 certificates.

uid.description: The globally unique identifier for the cert.

certAssignmentDetails.description: Cert path assignments to set for an NGINX instance or instance groups.

created.description: Time at which the cert was created.

instanceDeployments.description: Deployment identifiers for updates to instanceRefs and instanceGroupRefs. Not returned by GET requests.

instanceGroupRefs.description: References to instance group(s) where the cert will be published to.

modified.description: Time at which the cert was last modified.

uid.description: The globally unique identifier for the cert. SerialNumber as unique identifier for certs will be deprecated in a future release.

validFrom.description: The start of the validity period for the certificate.

validTo.description: The end of the validity period for the certificate.

CertificateDates.description:
The validity period for a certificate is the period of time from
   notBefore through notAfter, inclusive.

notAfter.description: end epoch time in which the certificate is valid

notBefore.description: start epoch time in which the certificate is valid

max_node_count.description: Max count of nodes in the cluster reported in the time period.

node_count.description: Current count of nodes in the cluster.

createTime.description:
A timestamp that represents the server time when the resource was created.

Create time is not guaranteed to be set in "happens-before" order
across separate operations.

In JSON format, `create_time` type is encoded as a string in the
[RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

For example: 2018-04-01T01:30:15.01Z

Create Time is assigned by the server and cannot be changed.

displayName.description:
`displayName` is a user friendly resource name. It can be used to define
a longer, and less constrained, name for a resource.

monthReturned.description: `monthReturned` indicates what month the record is reporting.

uid.description:
Unique Identifier (UID)

UID is a unique identifier in time and space for a resource.
When you create a resource, the server assigns a UID to the resource.

Refer to [IETF RFC 4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122) for more information.

updateTime.description:
A timestamp that represents the server time when the resource was last modified.

Resources that have never been updated do not have an `update_time` stamp.

The default value for resources that have never been updated is the local
language-specific equivalent of "null".

In JSON format, `update_time` type is encoded as a string as described in
[RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

node_count.description: Current count of nodes in the cluster.

ConfigAnalysisRequest.description: Defines the configuration file to be analyzed.

completeConfig.description:
The uploaded set of files represent a complete configuration.  Set this property to false to analyze
a single configuration file.

files.description: The list of NGINX configuration files to be analyzed.

rootDir.description: The root path of NGINX configuration.

message.description: A human-readable message that provides additional information about the configuration operation.

files.description: Array of files that make up the configuration.

rootDir.description: Root directory of the files contained within the payload.

ConfigState.description:
A representation of the resource's current configuration state
that comprises the status of the resource itself (`selfConfigState`) and any child
resources (`childrenConfigState`).

The conditions array provides additional information during configuration changes.

configured.description: The number of resources that have a complete and valid configuration.

configuring.description: The number of resources that are in the process of being configured.

deleting.description: The number of resources that are in the process of being deleted.

error.description: The number of resources that have encountered an error during the configuration process.

isConfiguring.description: The configuration of the resource, or of its child(ren), is in process.

isDeleting.description: A delete operation is in progress for the resource or its child(ren).

isError.description: An error occurred while configuring the resource or its child(ren).

total.description: The total number of resources to which the configuration operation applies.

ConfigVersion.description: The configuration version for a NGINX instance or instance group.

createTime.description: The time when configuration was created.

uid.description: Unique identifier for the NGINX instance or instance group.

versionHash.description: Unique hash for all the configuration file contents.

names.description: The feature(s) or object(s) having a conflict.

code.description: ISO-3166-1 format based on MaxMind GeoIP Country Code Database.

displayName.description: User friendly NGINX instance group name.

name.description: The unique name for this group. This cannot be changed after creation.

status.description:
The possible publish statuses are listed below
* unknown: initiated but never processed
* pending: paused and waiting for additional payloads to be available
* successful: completed successfully
* failed: failed, information regarding the failure available in the details
* degraded: one or more members of an instance group is in a failed state
Deployment in pending state could be due to: config validation taking longer than expected; waiting on
additional payloads to be ready before proceeding.

InstanceActivityStatus.description:
Represents a Pending deployment status for an NGINX instance, provide additional information on work in progress
deployments.

message.description: additional message about the instance deployment status.

name.description: this is the identifier for the system, typically the systemUID.

status.description:
status of the pending deployment to the instance.
The possible statuses are listed below
* wait_queue: initial state for the status, the deployment is being processed in the deployment, and has not being put in the queue pipeline to send to the agent.
* wait_payload: the deployment is waiting for additional payload in the dataplane-manager, see message for additional detailed information.
* queued: the deployment has been put into the deployment queue, and is waiting to be deployed to the agent.
* agent_sent: the deployment was sent to the agent, and dataplane-manager is waiting on completion status from the agent.
* agent_processing: the deployment was sent to the agent, and agent has reported that its processing the change.
* agent_pending: the deployment was sent to the agent, and agent has reported that the change is being processed but taking longer than expected.
* finalized_success: dataplane-manager has received the final status of the deployment from the agent, and change was reported successful.
* finalized_failed: dataplane-manager has received the final status of the deployment from the agent, and change was reported successful. See message for additional detailed information.

LicenseStatus.description:
Status of the current instance with respect to the license.
- `NONE`: The current instance is not yet licensed.
- `INVALID`: The current instance has at least one entitlement in non-functional license status.
- `ENFORCED`: The current instance has at least one entitlement in enforced license status and no entitlements in non-functional status.
- `GRACE`: The current instance has at least one entitlement in grace period license status and no entitlements in enforced or non-functional status.
- `VALID`: The current instance has valid entitlement(s) that have no adverse license statuses.
- `CORRUPTED`: The license for the current instance is corrupted. Upload the license file again to rectify the status.
- `EXPIRED`: The license for the current instance is expired. Upload the valid license file to rectify the status.

PEM.description:
Defines a PEM-formatted certificate that contains a key and certificates.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`).
The private key data will be redacted in the response for all get and list requests. The private key data is
required when creating a new cert.

caCerts.description:
An optional list of intermediate certificates in PEM format that are used to validate the public certificate.
Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`).

password.description: The passphrase to use to decrypt the private key. Required if the private key is encrypted.

privateKey.description:
The private key used to sign the public certificate.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`). The private key data will be redacted in the response for all get and list requests.

publicCert.description:
The end-entity certificate, in PEM format.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`).

get.description:
Lists all of the Dimension resources in the Catalog.

Dimensions provide a means of refining the data returned by metrics and events queries.
You can use the List Dimensions Catalog endpoint to find out what Dimensions are available.
Then, use the Get a Dimension endpoint to find out more about a specific dimension.

200.description: Successfully returned the requested Dimensions Catalog list.

get.description:
Lists all of the Metric resources in the Catalog.

The Metrics Catalog contains the definitions for all of the available NGINX and NGINX Manager Agent metrics.
You can use the Catalogs API to find information about the available Metrics, then use those Metrics to refine your Analytics data queries.

get.summary: Get a Metric Description

get.description: Returns a paginated list of system Events.

parameters.description:
Indicates how the results will be ordered.

Consists of at most three comma-separated clauses in the form `<dimension><single space><sort order>` or `<dimension>` where:
- `<dimension>` is the name of the dimension.
- `<sort order>` is the order by which the specified dimension will be sorted. Valid sort order is either "ASC" for ascending order, or "DESC" for descending order. If no sort order is provided, the default one ("ASC") will be used.

Note that if no orderBy is provided, the default combination of descending "timestamp" and ascending "id" will be used regardless. If you provide different order for "timestamp" or "id" in orderBy, the default one will be overwritten.
parameters.name: orderBy

200.description: Successfully returned the requested Events.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

get.description:
Returns system Metrics data based on the query parameters provided.

Supports filtering based on name and/or timestamp; aggregation over a configurable time span; and grouping by dimension.

parameters.description:
Identifies the Metrics data that you want to receive.

- Provide multiple names as a comma-separated list.
- You can provide an aggregate function for each Metric (`AVG`, `SUM`, `COUNT`, `MAX`, `MIN`, or `RATE`).
- Combining non-aggregated and aggregated Metrics in a single query would apply any `groupBy` clause to only the latter.
- Metrics with aggregates require the `startTime` parameter.
parameters.name: names

parameters.description:
Groups the results according to the specified dimension(s).

- Provide multiple dimension names as a comma-separated list.
- All Metric names that you pass into the `names` parameter must be aggregated for the `groupBy` to work.
parameters.name: groupBy

parameters.description:
Sets an upper limit on the number of series returned.
Always returns additional series with dimension value named `all` (aggregating the values of all the metrics included in the results).
If the result does not include `all` stored dimensions values, the Metrics query returns series with dimension value named `other` (aggregating the values of all the metrics not included in the results).
Has to be used along with the `orderSeriesBy` parameter.

- Exactly one groupBy parameter must be provided in the query
- Cannot be used along with `dimensions` parameter.
parameters.name: seriesLimit

parameters.description:
Sorts the results according to the order specified. 

Used along with the `seriesLimit` parameter.
parameters.name: orderSeriesBy

parameters.description:
List of dimensions that should be returned in the response for each metric series.

Dimensions not specified in this parameter will be hidden in the results.
This might result in series having exact same dimension set, but being visible as separate.

If the `aggregation` and `groupBy` parameters are provided for a metric, any dimension provided in
the `dimensions` query parameter also has to be provided in the `groupBy` parameter.

Dimensions provided in the `groupBy` query parameter do not have to be provided in the `dimensions` query parameter.

- To get a single series, provide the metric name with aggregation and the dimensions parameter with an empty value.
- Cannot be used along with `seriesLimit`.
parameters.name: dimensions

200.description: Successfully returned the requested Metrics data.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

404.description: The resource defined in the URI could not be found. Check the URI for errors and try again.

get.description: Returns the summary of your NGINX Plus usage.

parameters.description: Indicates the start date to include instances that have been reported from (inclusive).
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description:
Indicates the end date to include instances that have been reported until this date (non-inclusive).

- Must be greater than `startDate`.
- If `endDate` is not specified when `startDate` is present, `endDate` defaults to the current date.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description:
When set to true, it returns the result for aggregate functions (`AVG`, `MAX`, `MIN`) for hourly counts of NGINX Plus instances in the system for the requested date-time range.

- If no `startDate` and `endDate` are provided, aggregate function (`AVG`, `MAX`, `MIN`) returns inventory data for last thirty days.
parameters.name: aggregate

parameters.description:
When set to true, it returns the hourly timestamps with values of total number of NGINX Plus instances running during that hour in the system for the requested date-time range.

- `aggregate` must be set to true for detailed view.
- If no `startDate` and `endDate` are provided, detailed view returns inventory data for last thirty days.
parameters.name: detailedView
